meanings.definition: To scatter or cause to scatter in a fluid manner
meanings.sent1: The kids splashed in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent2: She splashed water on her face to cool down.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy splashed water everywhere during bath time.
meanings.sent4: The artist splashed paint across the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The waves splashed against the rocks, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To mark or cover with spots or patches of color
meanings.sent1: She accidentally splashed paint on her new shirt.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully splashed different colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The chef splashed sauce on the plate, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The sky was splashed with shades of pink and orange during sunset.
meanings.sent5: The garden was splashed with vibrant flowers of all colors.

meanings.definition: A sound made by something striking or falling into liquid
meanings.sent1: The loud splash of the rock hitting the water echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The splash of the fish jumping out of the pond surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The splash of the raindrops on the roof was a comforting lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The splash of the waterfall could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The splash of the waves against the boat created a rhythmic melody.
